intro: Dinebra retroflexa var. retroflexa, commonly known as the scarlet spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, red-orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
